Detailed Description

Helps to assemble an OBEX header from several chunks of data.

Warning;
This is an internal utility class interface and must not be used outside APOXI at all. However, developers of Transport Adapters for APOXI OBEX may find this class helpful.

It is used to assemble ObexHeader objects from multiple chunks of data as it becomes necessary when the transport protocol does segmentation of OBEX packets. Additionally, presentation decoding is supported which becomes necessary when the host byte order is different from OBEX byte order.

See also:
ObexHeaderList

Member Function Documentation

ObexResult ObexHeaderBuilder::AppendData (  const UINT8  data[],
UINT16  length
) 
 

Appends data bytes to the header under construction.

Parameters:
data Data buffer from which data can be read
length Length of the data block in octets.
Returns:
ObexResult which evaluates to 'TRUE' in case of success, 'FALSE' otherwise.

BOOLEAN ObexHeaderBuilder::IsComplete (   )  const
 

Tells whether the header being built is complete.

Returns:
'TRUE' when the size of the header value is equal or greater than the size provided when NewHeader() was called, \'FALSE' otherwise.

ObexResult ObexHeaderBuilder::NewHeader (  UINT8  id,
UINT16  max_size = 0
) 
 

Starts a new OBEX header.

Tells the builder to start building a new OBEX header and reserves space for 'max_size' octets of header data. The header type is determined from 'id'. If the header type is ByteType or LongType the size is automatically set to the correct value and 'max_size' is ignored, hence the parameter can be omitted in this case.

Parameters:
id OBEX Header Id of the header to be assembled
max_size Maximum size of the header to be assembled
Returns:
ObexResult which evaluates to 'TRUE' in case of success, 'FALSE' otherwise.

ObexResult ObexHeaderBuilder::SetValue (  UINT32  value  ) 
 

Builds a 1 or 4 byte header from a 32 integer value.

This function should be called only if the entity under construction is an OBEX 1 Byte or 4 Byte header. It is mainly provided to ease interfacing with the Extended Systems IrDA stack.

Parameters:
value Value to construct header from, in HOST byte order !
Returns:
ObexResult which evaluates to 'TRUE' in case of success, 'FALSE' otherwise.
